item.title: Hannah Arendt
item.description: Understanding When I am working, I am not interested in how my work might affect people. [And when I am finished] I am finished. What is important to me is to understand. For me, writing is a matter of seeking this understanding … certain things get formulated. […] What is important to me is the process of thought itself. You ask about the effects of my work on others.
